subject: Re: New film involving the Shinsengumi

Thanks for bringing this film to our attention Mary-Ann,
and as you have correctly assumed, KUNOICHI: DEADLY MIRAGE is NOT a 
masterpiece...

Wounds please add to our Shinsengumi files because it is a good 
example how zombies and Shinsengumi and historical innaccuracy do not 
mix...so this film is "educational" in that sense

Download the screencaps here...(my screencaps are rated-G and does 
not contain the graphic violence towards women shown in the film)
http://1happyturtle.com/makoto/KunoichiDeathMirage.zip

It's soooo BAD...I don't know where to begin

At first I thought there was some potential...kunoichi sneaks into
Hijikata's room (^_^)...but folks it goes downhill from there 
really...do not rent or buy this film...I mean it isn't even logical 
in its overall bad taste (I highly doubt numerous Shinsengumi would 
run to the gate to see a geisha---as if they've NEVER seen a pretty 
woman before)...film contains violence towards women, nudity, zombies 
with slime,laser beams... and the HIjikata (let's just say he IS NOT 
Koji Yamamoto)...and according to this film we have it all wrong you 
see the Shinsengumi were planning to burn down Kyoto and abduct the 
emperor...had it not been for Okita (who is the ONLY person who sees 
the black cat) and his attraction to Kagerou, the female ninja who 
wears red, then the super secret letter would've been delivered and 
who knows what would've happened....I've seen better films made in 
highschools...even the zombies were aweful...I can't believe it mixes 
GRAPHIC violence with might morphin power ranger effects.

Hopefully KUnoichi: Lady Ninja (about Aizu ninja according to the 
cover) is better.

secretarytocapt3

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "Mary-Ann" <maryannsfanfic@y...> wrote:
> 
> Hi!
> 
> I do not think that this has been brought to the attention of this 
ML 
> before, I'm sorry if it has. There is a new film featuring our 
> favorite boys in blue called: Kunoichi: Deadly Mirage. 
> 
> I haven't seen it, but from what I can understand it is not a 
> strictly historical movie, it's a fiction where Satsuma sends five 
> Kunoichi to spy on the Shinsengumi. Apparently, it also involves 
some 
> supernatural events. I'm under the impression that it is not really 
a 
> masterpiece, but if you are interrested, more info can be found 
here:
> 
> http://www.dvdlister.com/title.dvd/66d19V6634fs433aceT/
> 
> Mary-Ann
